rComments: This class was really boring. I fell asleep many times. You really have to show up to class though to get the questions right on the exams. Which are only what your grade is based on.

A hideous experience.  He would NOT slow down in lecture, everything was powerpoint, he would not post his notes on line, or answer questions at all.  Do NOT take this Professor.  A most unpleasant experience.
Know every single detail about every little thing & you will get you a good grade on the test, otherwise you'll be praying for a C...and that's with the curve.  Avoid this guy if you can!

Taiz was the most boring lecturer I have ever had. I have never slept in a class before I took his. Zzzzzzz. He has the most lame sound effects that I am sure he believes are entertaining. I got an A+ and so it is definitely possible but simply read the book and study his slides. Zzzzzzzz.

Ok so it's been far too long since this class... but plants was ok. Animal half was slightly better. I got a B in the class. Basically stick to lecture notes and skim the book. I did not attend class, just worked hard (very hard) on my own and with my housies

i enjoyed his lectures, he's a lot more active during his lectures, uses sound effects and stuff to keep you more interested. what he suggests you do to do well.. DO IT. go to lecture, read, compare both together and create your own outline. SO STUDY. but plants are boring. that is all.
Very nice; 5 quizes and a cumulative final (all mult. choice); fair grader, helpful, study hard! A little boring but pleasant to listen to. Great teacher overall!

this class was prety boring.  the only thing that keeps you awake are the odd noises his power point slides make, but even that gets old after a week or two, if that.  the tests blew--a lot of focus on irrelevant details like "who is this man shown in the picture?"  i thought concepts mattered more than faces.   have fun.
Lectures depend on powerpoint.  Uses alot of sound effects in them.  Allowed students to view lec. notes via Bio website which helped with studying for test.  Did much better than Ortiz.

Mind-numbingly boring. Strongly advise you to not take this class unless the history of the discovery of sex in plants makes you tingle. You must attend class everyday and download the slides from the library to pass. I tried to steal his laser-pointer, to be honest, and I suggest someone else tries because it will drive you nuts.

interesting material but the powerpoints were pretty boring.  test was pretty tricky and focused alot on detail (some of them unimportant).  but if you go over the slides online in a group and really talk about them in detail you can do well in the class.

Maybe plants arent my thing, but this guy bores the crap out of me.  Don't get me wrong, if you like a slow, monotonous voice reading straight from p.p. slides, then you'll love him.  He's a nice guy, but I'd rather have him read me bedtime stories.  He did have a few moments of flare though (for an old guy at 8 AM).

Really loves the material, and that shows in the class. Can be alternately really boring/really interesting. Mostly historical, covering agriculture, (history of) biology, cultural attitudes, etc. Detail orientated. TAKE NOTES.

Don't miss class, this guy is RIGID about attendance and grading policy. He's pretty lovable and geeky, though.  Tests and lectures were pretty boring/soporific. I didn't retain any of the material, but the book's good, and he loves questions.

2 midterms and a final. It is an interesting class. Not all just plant structures, should be called plant biochemistry. He expects a lot out of you as far as what you need to know for the tests. If you read the book, pay attention in class, and take notes, you'll do just fine.

Did a little better job than Ortiz in covering all the subjects he was going to test on, but was a highly boring and difficult teacher.  His lectures allowed me to get better sleep than staying at home in bed.  His powerpoints were helpful though.

Did a much better job lecturing than ortiz did for the animal half of the coarse. his lectures were all power point and very clear. they were posted online and he had practice tests which were helpful. he tested on very minor details which would screw you on his tests. the tests were hard.

Lectures depended heavily on power point.  Taiz was very clear in presenting information and materials covered in class.  But watch out-- he tends to test on micro details about plants and do take notes and read notes/book since both are essential to get a good grade.  A much better professor than O

Excellent teacher and truly wonderful class about the history of sex in plants. The course was very well presented through powerpoint presentations and Prof. Taiz made it well worth the time to attend lectures. If you can stay committed to this class then definitely take it.

All of his lectures are presented as powerpoints that he posts online prior to lecture. His wording on tests can sometimes be confusing & he concentrates on DETAIL! Know the little random facts that u would never believe u would be tested on. Trust me, I received an A, I'm not another bitter student

Pf. Taiz is friendly, non-intimidating, and has a quirky sense of humor. The lectures were ok, but the final was a beast- not difficult but it tested on very specific, odd examples of info instead of concepts, application, and reasoning. If you're good at photographic-memorizing, you'll do well.

He's a lot better than Ortiz. So you'll have a more enjoyable experience the 2nd half of the quarter. His provides powerpoints, but many of his questions are very exact, and require careful reading. However, Taiz does not provide OH and alternatively welcomes emails (very slow to does not respond).
Goes through slides fast, just listen and write ocasional notes, everything is very clear in text, nice dude, avg tests.  Just read and you too can get an easy B.
He presents the material in the book clearly in lecture, very comprehensive, definately cares that his students are getting what he is talking about.  Good prof

I took the SECRET SEX LIVES OF PLANTS. This class was awesome! I loved every moment. This is the kind of class that I may pop in for fun to re-live the experience It was the history of botany done in powerpoints with funny pictures and sounds.
